newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: Record rise on Abidjan Stock Exchange.
newsitem.headline: Record rise on Abidjan Stock Exchange.

text.p: The Abidjan Stock Exchange notched up record rises in the week to Friday, with both the All-Share and the Blue-Chip indices jumping by over three percent, its market report showed.
With brewer SOLIBRA (+3,800 CFA francs to 78,800 CFA) leading the way, the blue-chip 12VB index rose 3.92 percent to 313.84 points. The surge took the rise on the year to 29.5 percent.
The All-Share BVA index rose 3.13 percent to close at 441.29 points, taking the rise on the year to 23.34 percent.
In the previous week, the 12VB index rose 2.08 percent, the BVA index by 1.68 percent.
The other blue-chip risers this week were NESTLE (3,310 to 67,670),tobacco company SITAB (3,000 to 55,500), consumer products manufacturer BLOHORN (2,320 to 46,820) and bank BICICI (2,210 to 45,250).
The only faller was publisher CEDA (-50 to 9,550).
In total 9,896 shares changed hands, compared to 5,664 the previous week.
